text: Contributions welcome form pull requests.

title: Contributing
text: epocakir written pure R. ’ll need R>=4.0 dev packages. Currently R Tools required.
code: install.packages(c("devtools", "roxygen2", "lintr", "styler", "testthat", "knitr"))

title: Contributing
text: epocakir standard, single R package R code R/ directory, data data/ directory testing using testthat.
code: epocakir/ ├── .github/                # GitHub Actions ├── R/                      # R source code │   ├── aki.R │   ├── ... │ ├── data/                   # .rda Data files │   ├── aki_pt_data.rda │   ├── ... │ ├── data-raw/               # Data origin │   ├── aki-data.R │   ├── ... │ ├── man/                    # Docs auto-generated with roxygen │   ├── aki_bCr.Rd │   ├── ... │ ├── tests/                  # Testing │   ├── testthat.R │   └── testthat │       ├── test-aki.R │       ├── ... │ ├── cran-comments.md        # CRAN submission comments ├── DESCRIPTION             # Package metadata ├── NAMESPACE               # Auto-generated with roxygen ├── README.Rmd              # Package README ├── README.md               # Auto-generated with knitr ├── ...

title: Contributing
text: ’re using RStudio, press Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + T (run devtools::test() ) run tests package.
code: devtools::test() #> ℹ Testing epocakir #> ✔ | F W  S  OK | Context #> ✔ |         24 | aki #> ✔ |          6 | anemia #> ✔ |        529 | ckd [1.0s] #> ✔ |         44 | utils #> #> ══ Results ════════════════════════════ #> Duration: 2.1 s #> #> [ FAIL 0 | WARN 0 | SKIP 0 | PASS 603 ]

title: Contributing
text: Documentation generated source code using roxygen2. add documentation function, add comment block function.

title: Contributing
text: build documentation, run following command R console: build pkgdown website run following command R console:
code: devtools::document() pkgdown::build_site()

title: Contributing
text: Set GitHub personal access token repository create GitHub issue checklist. Run checks required, additional ones :
code: # Creat new GitHub issue usethis::use_release_issue() # Run additional checks devtools::spell_check() urlchecker::url_check() rhub::check_for_cran() rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck(args = c("--no-manual", "--as-cran"), error_on = "warning", check_dir = "check") revdepcheck::revdep_check(num_workers = 4) devtools::check_rhub() devtools::check_mac_release() devtools::check_win_devel()

title: Contributing
text: Please make sure releases master branch. Instead using usethis::use_version('minor'), commitizen used instead. devtools::submit_cran()
code: git checkout master && git pull --rebase git merge --no-ff rc-1.0.0 cz bump --increment MAJOR codemetar::write_codemeta() git add codemeta.json git commit --amend --no-edit

title: Introduction to epocakir
text: epocakir package makes clinical coding patients kidney disease using clinical practice guidelines easy. guidelines used evidence-based KDIGO guidelines. package covers acute kidney injury (AKI), anemia, chronic liver disease(CKD).

title: Introduction to epocakir
text: aki_staging(): Classification AKI staging (aki_stages) automatic selection : aki_bCr(): AKI based baseline creatinine aki_SCr(): AKI based changes serum creatinine aki_UO(): AKI based urine output anemia(): Classification anemia Classification albuminuria (Albuminuria_stages) Albuminuria_staging_ACR(): Albuminuria based Albumin excretion rate Albuminuria_staging_AER(): Albuminuria based Albumin--creatinine ratio eGFR(): Estimation glomerular filtration rate automatic selection : eGFR_adult_SCr(): eGFR based 2009 CKD-EPI creatinine equation eGFR_adult_SCysC(): eGFR based 2012 CKD-EPI cystatin C equation eGFR_adult_SCr_SCysC(): eGFR based 2012 CKD-EPI creatinine-cystatin C equation eGFR_child_SCr(): eGFR based pediatric creatinine-based equation eGFR_child_SCr_BUN(): eGFR based pediatric creatinine-BUN equation eGFR_child_SCysC(): eGFR based pediatric cystatin C-based equation GFR_staging(): Staging GFR (GFR_stages) Multiple utility functions including: conversion_factors: Conversion factors used throughout KDIGO guidelines as_metric(): Conversion measured value metric units dob2age(): Calculation age date birth binary2factor(): Conversion binary data factors based column name combine_date_time_cols(): Combining separate date time columns single date time column combn_changes: Generating changes measurements Automatic conversion units class objects Tidy output allowing seamless integration functions tidyverse Tidyeval via programming dplyr Comprehensive tests coverage

title: Introduction to epocakir
code: library(epocakir) library(dplyr) library(units)

title: Introduction to epocakir
text: Often clinical data must cleansed tidied analysis can begin. assist , several utility functions included. explore , consider sample clinical dataset clinical_obvs: Make sure use set_units() units package convert measurements unit objects automatic unit conversion epocakir.
code: # Example workflow: clinical_obvs <- read.csv("cohort.csv") glimpse(clinical_obvs) #> Rows: 3 #> Columns: 9 #> $ `Patient Number` <chr> "p10001", "p10002", "p10003" #> $ `Admission Date` <chr> "2020-03-05", "2020-03-06", "2020-03-17" #> $ `Admission Time` <chr> "14:01:00", "09:10:00", "12:48:00" #> $ Discharge_date   <chr> "2020-03-10", "2020-03-16", "2020-03-18" #> $ Discharge_time   <chr> "16:34:00", "18:51:00", "09:12:00" #> $ `Date of Birth`  <chr> "1956-01-09", "1997-12-04", "1973-05-28" #> $ Male             <lgl> TRUE, FALSE, TRUE #> $ Height           <dbl> 182, 161, 168 #> $ Surgery          <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, TRUE  tidy_obvs <- clinical_obvs %>%   combine_date_time_cols() %>%   mutate(     Age = dob2age(`Date of Birth`),     Height = as_metric(height = set_units(as.numeric(Height), "cm"))   ) %>%   binary2factor(Male, Surgery)  glimpse(tidy_obvs) #> Rows: 3 #> Columns: 8 #> $ `Patient Number`     <chr> "p10001", "p10002", "p10003" #> $ `Admission DateTime` <dttm> 2020-03-05 14:01:00, 2020-03-06 09:10:00, 2020-03… #> $ Discharge_DateTime   <dttm> 2020-03-10 16:34:00, 2020-03-16 18:51:00, 2020-0… #> $ `Date of Birth`      <chr> "1956-01-09", "1997-12-04", "1973-05-28" #> $ Male                 <ord> Male, Not_Male, Male #> $ Height               [m] 1.82 [m], 1.61 [m], 1.68 [m] #> $ Surgery              <ord> Not_Surgery, Not_Surgery, Surgery #> $ Age                  <Duration> 2202768000s (~69.8 years), 880416000s (~27.9 yea…

title: Introduction to epocakir
text: Next consider sample aki_pt_data dataset. possible use aki_staging() automatically classify presence staging AKI. particular method required, possible classify AKI using aki_bCr(), aki_SCr() aki_UO().
code: # Example workflow: aki_pt_data <- read.csv("aki.csv") head(aki_pt_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>      SCr_    bCr_ pt_id_ dttm_      UO_ aki_staging_type aki_        #>   [mg/dl] [mg/dl] <chr>  <dttm> [ml/kg] <chr>            <ord>       #> 1     2       1.5 NA     NA          NA aki_bCr          No AKI      #> 2     2.5     1.5 NA     NA          NA aki_bCr          AKI Stage 1 #> 3     3       1.5 NA     NA          NA aki_bCr          AKI Stage 2 #> 4     3.5     1.5 NA     NA          NA aki_bCr          AKI Stage 2 #> 5     4       1.5 NA     NA          NA aki_bCr          AKI Stage 3 #> 6     4.5     1.5 NA     NA          NA aki_bCr          AKI Stage 3  aki_staging(aki_pt_data,   SCr = "SCr_", bCr = "bCr_", UO = "UO_",   dttm = "dttm_", pt_id = "pt_id_" ) #>  [1] No AKI      AKI Stage 1 AKI Stage 2 AKI Stage 2 AKI Stage 3 AKI Stage 3 #>  [7] No AKI      No AKI      AKI Stage 1 No AKI      No AKI      AKI Stage 1 #> [13] No AKI      No AKI      No AKI      AKI Stage 1 No AKI      AKI Stage 2 #> [19] AKI Stage 3 AKI Stage 1 AKI Stage 3 AKI Stage 2 No AKI      AKI Stage 1 #> [25] AKI Stage 3 AKI Stage 3 No AKI      #> Levels: No AKI < AKI Stage 1 < AKI Stage 2 < AKI Stage 3  aki_pt_data %>%   mutate(aki = aki_staging(     SCr = SCr_, bCr = bCr_, UO = UO_,     dttm = dttm_, pt_id = pt_id_   )) %>%   select(pt_id_, SCr_:dttm_, aki) #> # A tibble: 27 × 5 #>    pt_id_    SCr_    bCr_ dttm_               aki         #>    <chr>  [mg/dl] [mg/dl] <dttm>              <ord>       #>  1 NA         2       1.5 NA                  No AKI      #>  2 NA         2.5     1.5 NA                  AKI Stage 1 #>  3 NA         3       1.5 NA                  AKI Stage 2 #>  4 NA         3.5     1.5 NA                  AKI Stage 2 #>  5 NA         4       1.5 NA                  AKI Stage 3 #>  6 NA         4.5     1.5 NA                  AKI Stage 3 #>  7 pt1        3.4    NA   2020-10-23 09:00:00 No AKI      #>  8 pt1        3.9    NA   2020-10-25 21:00:00 No AKI      #>  9 pt1        3      NA   2020-10-20 09:00:00 AKI Stage 1 #> 10 pt2        3.4    NA   2020-10-18 22:00:00 No AKI      #> # ℹ 17 more rows  aki_pt_data %>%   mutate(aki = aki_SCr(     SCr = SCr_, dttm = dttm_, pt_id = pt_id_   )) %>%   select(pt_id_, SCr_:dttm_, aki) #> # A tibble: 27 × 5 #>    pt_id_    SCr_    bCr_ dttm_               aki         #>    <chr>  [mg/dl] [mg/dl] <dttm>              <ord>       #>  1 NA         2       1.5 NA                  No AKI      #>  2 NA         2.5     1.5 NA                  No AKI      #>  3 NA         3       1.5 NA                  No AKI      #>  4 NA         3.5     1.5 NA                  No AKI      #>  5 NA         4       1.5 NA                  No AKI      #>  6 NA         4.5     1.5 NA                  No AKI      #>  7 pt1        3.4    NA   2020-10-23 09:00:00 No AKI      #>  8 pt1        3.9    NA   2020-10-25 21:00:00 No AKI      #>  9 pt1        3      NA   2020-10-20 09:00:00 AKI Stage 1 #> 10 pt2        3.4    NA   2020-10-18 22:00:00 No AKI      #> # ℹ 17 more rows

title: Introduction to epocakir
text: Similarly, eGFR() offers ability automatically select appropriate formula estimate glomerular filtration rate. particular formula required, eGFR_adult_SCr, eGFR_adult_SCysC, eGFR_adult_SCr_SCysC, eGFR_child_SCr, eGFR_child_SCr_BUN, eGFR_child_SCysC can used.
code: # Example workflow: aki_pt_data <- read.csv("aki.csv") head(eGFR_pt_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>    SCr_ SCysC_  Age_ male_ black_ height_  BUN_ eGFR_calc_type_ eGFR_ pediatric_ #>   [mg/… [mg/L] [yea… <lgl> <lgl>      [m] [mg/… <chr>           [mL/… <lgl>      #> 1   0.5   NA      20 FALSE FALSE       NA    NA eGFR_adult_SCr   139. title: Codify AKI from Serum Creatinine and/or Urine Output — aki_staging
text: Provided baseline creatinine, series Serum Creatinine readings /Urine Output, aki_staging() calculates whether patient AKI. staging (1, 2, 3) AKI returned. multiple columns provided, aki_staging() automatically calculate whether AKI occurred using KDIGO definition. aki_bCr(): Staging AKI based baseline serum creatinine aki_SCr(): Staging AKI based changes serum creatinine aki_UO(): Staging AKI based urine output severe AKI stage returned.
